intro: Puccinellia laevis, commonly known as smooth glassworts, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in saline or coastal environments, such as salt marshes and tidal flats. The plant has slender, erect stems with small, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and glabrous. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, and they are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Puccinellia laevis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates in its native range.
